markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Dryad](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3112)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Dryads are fey guardians of the trees and creatures who dwell in wooded areas. They prefer using indirect methods to dissuade those who would harm their sacred groves and beloved forests, but they're not above using magic to enlist the aid of allies when evil threats cannot be dissuaded with words alone. In times of peace, dryads happily live secluded lives inside their trees, and a community at harmony with nature might not even realize a dryad lives nearby.

 Though they watch over all the woods around them, dryads are inextricably tied to a specific tree, usually an oak. Dryads who are bonded to another type of tree are fundamentally the same, but they may differ in temperament and appearance to match their chosen ward. For instance, kraneiai, or cherry-tree dryads, have beautiful pink coloration and concern themselves with the fragile beauty of life.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Fey](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 18

**[Recall Knowledge - Plant](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43)): DC 18

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 16

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 13
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Dryad.webp" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 3">[Dryad](/Monsters.aspx?ID=3112)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Fey" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=599" />
<trait label="Nymph" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=764" />
<trait label="Plant" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=668" />
<trait label="Wood" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=508" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Monster Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=221) pg. 244 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Perception** +10; [low-light vision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=69)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Fey](/Languages.aspx?ID=119), [Muan](/Languages.aspx?ID=108)

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +9, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +5, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +7, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +9, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10) +13, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +9, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +12

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +0

**Dex** +4

**Con** +1

**Int** +2

**Wis** +3

**Cha** +4
</row>

**Nature Empathy** The dryad can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) skill with [animals](/Traits.aspx?ID=531) and [plants](/Traits.aspx?ID=668).

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 17 

**Fort** +6 

**Ref** +11 

**Will** +10 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 55

</row>

**Weaknesses**
[cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 5, [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=604) 5

**Tree Dependent** A dryad is bonded to a single great tree. If she is more than 300 feet away from it for 24 hours or more, she gains the [weak](/Rules.aspx?ID=791) adjustments until she returns. She can perform a 24-hour ritual to bond herself to a new tree.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
branch +12 ([Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)),
**Damage** 1d12+2 bludgeoning

**Primal Innate Spells** DC 20, attack +12
- **Cantrips (2nd)**
[Tangle Vine](/Spells.aspx?ID=1713)
- **2nd**
[Entangling Flora](/Spells.aspx?ID=1515) (at will), [One with Plants](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618) (at will)
- **4th**
[Charm](/Spells.aspx?ID=34) (×3), [Suggestion](/Spells.aspx?ID=315)
- **5th**
[Nature's Pathway](/Spells.aspx?ID=1613) (×2)

**Tree Meld** <actions string="Two Actions" />  A [_one with plants_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1618) spell cast by a dryad has an unlimited duration. In addition, if the dryad merges with her bonded tree, she can choose to instead enter an extradimensional living space within the tree, and can bring up to two adjacent, willing creatures with her; the spell gains the [extradimensional](/Traits.aspx?ID=596) trait. The dryad can still be expelled from this space.

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-449" />
name: Dryad
